titles: Tydings from Rome: or, Englands alarm Wherein several grounds to suspect the prevalency of the popish interest are seasonably suggested; Londons ruine pathetically lamented; arguments to disswade from the popish religion, are urged; and the duties of Christians in this time of common danger, and distraction, perswaded.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Catholic Church --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  Church history --  17th century --  Early works to 1800.
